sen.e: Hirohide HIRATE (1553 - January 25, 1573) was a busho (Japanese military commander) during the Azuchi-Momoyama period.

sen.j: 元亀3年（1573年）の三方ヶ原の戦いに滝川一益・林秀貞・佐久間信盛・水野信元らと共に援軍として出陣したが、武田信玄の軍勢によって敗北した。
sen.e: He participated in the Battle of Mikatagahara as the reinforcement with Kazumasu TAKIGAWA, Hidesada HAYASHI, Nobumori SAKUMA, and Nobumoto MIZUNO, however, Oda's side lost by the superior army force of Singen TAKEDA.

sen.j: 一益・信盛らは早々に撤退したが、汎秀は家康と共に戦ったものの敗れ、浜松周辺の地理に不慣れだったこともあり退却に失敗し、追走してきた武田軍に討ち取られた。
sen.e: Even after Kazumasu and Nobumori retreated early during the battle, Hirohide continued to fight in the war with Ieyasu, however, their side lost in the war and maybe because he was not familiar with the geography around the areas of the Hamamatsu Province, he failed in the retreat and was killed by Takeda's army that came running towards him.

sen.j: 汎秀は信長に目をかけられた将の一人であり、信盛が後に信長によって追放される際には「信盛は秀貞・信元らとともに、汎秀を見殺しにした」との理由をつけられている。
sen.e: Hirohide was one of the busho favored by Nobunaga; when Nobunaga expelled Nobumori, the reason was that "together with Hidesada and Nobumoto, Nobumori retreated from the battle leaving Hirohide alone."
